medical_history.chief_complaint: Delirium 4 days post laparoscopic colon surgery.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient experienced several episodes of confusion, logorrhea, and disorientation on postoperative day 4. Initial symptoms occurred 4 days post-surgery. The patient's temperature was normal (37.2°C) but had a transient peak of 38.4°C previously. The patient's Glasgow Coma Scale score was 15. Physical examination revealed slight abdominal tenderness, diarrheic stool in the ileostomy, and normal cardiac and pulmonary auscultation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of major tobacco consumption (2 packs/day for 45 years), moderate hypertension, and peripheral vascular disease treated with bare metal stents in both iliac arteries and the left femoral artery 3 years ago.
medical_history.social_history: Currently smoking and has a long history of tobacco use.
